subject: Politics
title: Conspiracy Theories in Politics
description: A fast breakdown of Conspiracy Theories in Politics for builders.

hook.text: QAnon, flat earth, stolen elections â€” conspiracy theories aren't fringe anymore. They're shaping mainstream politics.

buildup.text: Conspiracy theories offer simple explanations for complex events. They blame hidden enemies for real grievances.

discovery.text: Social media algorithms amplify conspiracy content because it's engaging. The rabbit hole is designed into the system.

twist.text: Debunking conspiracies often backfires. Correction can reinforce belief through the 'backfire effect.'

climax.text: Conspiracy beliefs erode trust in institutions: science, elections, and government. Democracy needs baseline trust.

punchline.text: Conspiracies thrive on distrust. They offer certainty in a confusing world.

quiz.question: Why do conspiracy theories spread easily on social media?
options: Algorithms amplify engaging conspiracy content because it drives interaction
Social media companies manually promote conspiracy theories
Conspiracy theories are always factually accurate
